column1: https://www.edvardmunch.org/the-scream.jsp#
Yep. That’s the one.
Farside Gallery Boneless Chicken Ranch.
Lilo and Stich, The MovieBasically the whole entire movie.
Yes I thought of The Scream as well.This is a bit more cheerful: https:/…entertainment-arts-52109901
So funny. The Scream came to my mind first also.
Almost anything by Hieronymus Bosch!
Music is Art.The overture to “The Flying Dutchman” (Wagner) would express how I feel about this virus.
I quite like this humorous pocket exhibition curated from the Art Gallery of NSW - It's called Covid-19 for Dummies.  https:/…vyfxzrEdited: 8:09 pm, April 03, 2020
No, it was not a trick question but it is funny that it is the one that comes to mind for most of us.
https:/…Check out no. 48LOL.bet there are more memes of this piece.Edited: 11:28 am, April 04, 2020
Same as #2 without a second thought.
Bansky!!!https:/…757eba50-39c7-468a-ad0d-f423bc46fb84
I liked these, some are brillianthttps:/…

I also thought about 'The Scream' and another one from Munch , 'Anxiety'.But also at this one from Van Gogh:https:/…at-eternitys-gate.jspand somehow also at the 'Girl with a balloon' from Banksyhttps://www.a-n.co.uk/media/52446762/
Salvador Dali's Persistence of Memory
This also kinda sums it up.https:/…Edited: 7:53 am, April 22, 2020
The Scream painting does not express how I feel thank goodness but it’s very fitting for some others for sure.
Yarramar - I do not (yet) feel Anguish but I very much like that painting and hadn't seen it before so thank you for posting.
